page.title: 13 WANDLEBURY TREES
page.content: 64 types of tree, 25 types of shrub. 17,000 trees over 6 inches thick and 1\m. high. 60 one year old saplings planted in February. Tallest tree is 96 ft Lime. A 90 year old redwood will soon be taller. Biggest tree is a Beech 15 feet 4 inches in girth. Dutch elm disease destroyed 600 elms. 5 remaining elms also affected. 4000 trees planted in past 11 years, all paid for by general public or groups e.g. schools, Guides. Most common tree was elm, is now sycamore. Beech grows well here as it tolerates the chalky soil. This shallow soil can lead to instability of the trees. After a tree was uprooted in a recent storm the skeletons were found of Iron Age people killed in battle and left to lie where they fell. Rotten trees not cleared but left to encourage insects, food for other wild life.
